meanings.sent1: The chef added homogenates to the soup to give it a creamy texture.
meanings.sent2: The homogenates in the lotion help keep the skin moisturized.
meanings.sent3: The homogenates in the smoothie decided to stick together and form a dance group.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room, homogenating the somber atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The homogenates of colors in the painting created a beautiful blend.

meanings.definition: To make uniform or similar by mixing or blending.
meanings.sent1: She carefully homogenates the ingredients to ensure a consistent flavor in the dish.
meanings.sent2: The blender quickly homogenates the fruits into a smoothie.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to homogenate their toys into a giant pile for a game.
meanings.sent4: His speech homogenated various ideas into a coherent argument.
meanings.sent5: The music homogenates different genres to create a unique sound.
